Text.Value: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: subtle petulance and hurt.

Text.Value: My mum always said a drink's the most important meal of the day. Take your pick.

EditorData.NodeContext: player asked for a drink and you're 'working' at a bar, in your childish way - after this dialogue ends, a trade window opens with your character so there's no pulling of pints or fetching of bottles.

Text.Value: I musta dropped it. Well, you can look for it if you want.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nonchalant - it's not your problem.

Text.Value: Can I have it?
He called me a 'ragged little devil'.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated and upset. Hurt but tryiing not to show it. Could be mistaken for a bit bratty.

Text.Value: And now we're just trying to save him from drinking himself stupid!

EditorData.NodeContext: excitable - this adult you're talking to really gets that you're doing a good thing

Text.Value: Maybe.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bashful. Pleased that  grown up is praising him.

Text.Value: Do you really want to give it to him after how he acted?
All this whining is making me wish he hadn't saved you.
Fine. Here, you ... huh, where is it?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reaching behind back for the book to find it missing. Looking around - confused.
EditorData.NodeContext: You can't find the book on your person. You're looking around confused.

Text.Value: People just ran off and said nothing! Adults always do this.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: Eh? You forget something?

EditorData.NodeContext: surprised but not unfriendly

Text.Value: Right? He went through three bottles before I told him to stop.
Actually I just wanted a drink.
But he did save you - that's what matters.
He acts like he wished we weren't here - like he wished he hadn't saved us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated and upset. Hurt but tryiing not to show it. Could be mistaken for a bit bratty.

Text.Value: True. But I don't think he meant it.
He'll be losing his mind and his lunch if he keeps drinking like that.
I don't blame him - he wanted a drink, and you wouldn't serve him.
Fine. He'll probably hate it anyway. Here.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* V.O line, looks good. Clean with prop. <Logan P>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to player
EditorData.NodeContext: Dramatic sigh. Kind of bratty.

Text.Value: No need to snap at me.
What are you doing? You gotta get Mol. Don't make me regret trusting you with this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impatient out of concern. You're terrified for your friend.

Text.Value: Hmm. Maybe.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unsure about the gift you picked out. Doubting yourself.

Text.Value: Rolan isn't very good with kids.
It's for Rolan.

EditorData.NodeContext: with attitude!

Text.Value: If this is about Rolan, go away.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contact
EditorData.NodeContext: Upset frustrated

Text.Value: Next time, call him one back.
Give it to me, you brat. Now.
What do you mean, his loss?
You badger's backside-looking idiot.
You mentioned you had a magic book?
I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.
True. Guess I'll keep it then.

EditorData.NodeContext: With attitude - you know exactly what the player was trying to pull.

Text.Value: Which he shouldn't have done.
Fine. I will.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pouty and annoyed.

Text.Value: Guess you can have it then. I don't care.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to player
EditorData.NodeContext: You absolutely care

Text.Value: You're just as mean as the rest of 'em.
I'm sure it is. See you around, kid.
Stop interfering. Just stay out of his way - and mine.
Ignore him - he's more immature than you are.
Anyway, it's his loss.
I'm sorry he was mean.
A drunk wizard's a dangerous thing - all that uncontrolled power.
Yeah, well everyone says you smell like rotting badger, but they're wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bratty and impetulant. You're about to deliver a sick burn.

Text.Value: I get it - you were trying to look after him.
You're mean. Leave me alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad - not quite sniffling back tears, more peeved

Text.Value: Yeah. He did save us, after all.

EditorData.NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

Text.Value: I could use some supplies, if you've still got any.
How about a drink for me, instead?
Maybe. Thanks for... talking and stuff.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bashful. Pleased that  grown up is praising him.

Text.Value: You smell like crusty toe-jam - look it too. Bye.

EditorData.NodeContext: BUUUURN.

Text.Value: Leave.
Anyway, I'm sick of talking. You can go now. Bye-bye.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shrug and nonchalant as you end the convo

Text.Value: Bye!
Right? He might wave his arms wrong and burn the whole inn down, or belch up a puddle of acid.

EditorData.NodeContext: a smirk - enjoying ragging on an adult

Text.Value: Brat? Really? You can do better than that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unimpressed. With attitude.

Text.Value: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere and downcast.

Text.Value: Sorry. I didn't mean - here. Just go away!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* V.O line, looks good. Clean with prop. <Logan P>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to player
EditorData.NodeContext: Tense afraid.

Text.Value: Ignore Rolan. He's just a grump.
Please bring Mol back. Please.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.
EditorData.NodeContext: almost in tears

Text.Value: Very observant of him - that's exactly what you are.
I'll find out what's going on myself, thank you very much.

EditorData.NodeContext: confident

Text.Value: I will too!

EditorData.NodeContext: laughing at the thought. Chilish and excited

Text.Value: Never mind then.
Uh-huh. Like I've never used that one before.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rolls eyes. With attitude.

Text.Value: Take care.
The one for Rolan? What about it?

EditorData.NodeContext: suspicious

Text.Value: Darn shame too.
Why don't you keep it for yourself?
Leave.
Then he should say sorry - all I did was tell him he shouldn't drink anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: with attitude. Annoyed that the is player is here and rolan - who he feels should be apologising.

Text.Value: If you give it to me, I'll make sure he gets it.
I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.

EditorData.NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

Text.Value: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.

EditorData.NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

Text.Value: Nothing important - I just want a drink.
That's a great gift. I'm sure he'll love it.
Leave.
They took Mol - I couldn't stop them.

EditorData.NodeContext: in shock

Synopsis: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
